Santa Bailey, slip a sable under the tree for me 
Been an awful good boy. üòá

Christmas has arrived in mi casa! üê∂üéÑ I would also like to take this opportunity to thank you all for you advice, inspiration and support throughout the year. It really is fantastic to share our wonderful profession with you all and I look forward to sharing ideas and more hilarious memes with you in 2020. 
Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year to you and your family and I hope you enjoy the festivities, but also enjoy some well-earned rest which isn‚Äôt always so easy as a freelancer. 
I am now back in the UK to spend Christmas with my family and I am definitely in the Christmas spirit. So is my dog... All the best! ‚ô•Ô∏è #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #french #english #business #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #spain #barcelona #espa√±a  #wanderlust #expat #expatlife #digitalnomad #travel #christmas #dogsofinstagram

Driving [flying] home for Christmas! 
After kicking off this wonderful time of year in my new home, it‚Äôs time for me to fly back to the UK (for the handsome sum of ¬£4.52, cheers @ryanair). I don‚Äôt know about you but I‚Äôm definitely on the wind down to Christmas. However, there are still a few things to keep me busy until the big day, but nothing that can‚Äôt be achieved with the help of a mince pie or two.

Are you still working or are you en route to your Christmas festivities? 
Safe travels to wherever you are heading this Christmas! üéÑ

How do you like to spend your Sunday evenings? 
I like to spend mine planning my next week so I know exactly what awaits me at my desk on a Monday morning. 
This evening I‚Äôm clearing out my email inbox, eagerly awaiting a response from a potential direct client at a European university, planning work around my flight home for Christmas on Wednesday and finalising projects before the Christmas holidays.

I‚Äôm also testing out my new rose gold @logitech mouse which is perfect for when I‚Äôm on the move  as it‚Äôs super light and completely silent. Thanks for the recommendation @ab_reads. üê≠

It‚Äôs #friyay and Christmas will be here before we know it. This afternoon, I‚Äôm spending some time reflecting on how wonderful 2019 has been and how much I have achieved. I definitely think my greatest achievement in 2019 was moving my business to Spain to live and work in another country and learn a new language. Yesterday, a good friend of mine asked me what I hoped to achieve professionally in 2020. I didn‚Äôt really need much time to think about this question as I have a few potential direct clients that I have had my eye on for a while and I would like to try and win their business in 2020, in order to start some new and exciting collaborations. 
What do you hope to achieve professionally in 2020? 
I‚Äôm using this beautiful handmade leather notebook gifted to me yesterday to plan my year ahead. It was given to me as a Birthday gift by my very talented flatmate and friend. He sources the highest quality leather for the cover and then he binds it with the finest quality paper, finished off with a perfect little fastener to keep all your plans safe and sound. It‚Äôs almost too nice to use! 
Hit me up if you want to treat yourself to a notebook just like it and I will put you in touch. Made to measure with love. üìù

This was the first email that I received this morning. The client had already thanked me in our correspondence yesterday but went out of their way to update me and send me a lovely thank you message. 
This is a client that I always enjoy working with and our working relationship continues to flourish. üíå

Today is the ninth day of Advent. üïØ

Last night I took to the streets of Barcelona to explore the Christmas markets. The Feast of the Immaculate Conception, or the Dia de la Inmaculada Concepcion, as it is known in Spain, is an important date in the Catholic calendar. It is a national holiday and has a distinct feel of being the start of the Christmas period in Barcelona. 
I took the opportunity to wander around the streets of the centre of Barcelona to get a sense of what the day is all about in the city that I now call my home. The streets were packed with people and there was an electric atmosphere as people explored the market stalls.

The most popular Christmas market in Barcelona is the Fira De Santa Ll√∫cia, in the square of Barcelona Cathedral. For the Feast of the Immaculate Conception, many Spanish families come here to buy their Christmas trees, mistletoe and decorations. These include the Catalan Caga Tio. Just as children may visit Santa Claus in other parts of the world, a large Caga Tio is on display for long queues of youngsters eagerly awaiting small toys and lollipops. 
It was the perfect way to explore the Christmas traditions of my new home.  I ended my weekend watching Love Actually which is one of my own Christmas traditions. üåü

Happy Friday from my new desk in Barcelona. It was my first week back at work after the move and it‚Äôs gone swimmingly. I‚Äôm enjoying every minute of my new adventure! No regrets! Tonight, I‚Äôm swapping my translator hat for my chef‚Äôs hat as I‚Äôm standing in as my Chilean flatmate‚Äôs sous chef for the night. We are holding a little fiesta with friends and empanadas and pi√±a coladas galore to celebrate moving into our lovely little flat in the trendy, medieval part of the city. 
Que tengas un buen fin de semana! ü•≥

It‚Äôs the third day of Advent and Christmas has arrived in my Barcelona office. 
I‚Äôm really thankful to my clients for being so patient while I moved from the UK to Spain and I have received such lovely well wishes! ‚ò∫Ô∏è I am now settled into my new apartment and office in Barcelona and ready to get back to business as usual!

#traveltuesday 
Hello December! This is not the December I‚Äôm used to back home. I hear it‚Äôs sub-zero in the UK but I‚Äôm very comfortable in the current 18 degrees here in Spain. I even went out on Saturday night without a coat (don‚Äôt tell my mother)! I took this photo last week after having a picnic on the beach on my very first day here. It only takes me 15 minutes to walk to the beach from my apartment which is perfect when I want to stretch my legs on my lunch break. 
I‚Äôm absorbing as much Spanish as I can but I‚Äôm also really thankful for lots of signs just like this one which are in Catalan. I‚Äôm lucky enough to have a photographic memory so every time I read a sign here, it‚Äôs really good for building on my Catalan vocabulary. Even though it‚Äôs only been a week, if I don‚Äôt understand the word in Spanish there is still a good chance I might understand it in Catalan because of its affinity with French. 
La playa ‚Ä¢ La platja ‚Ä¢ La plage üèù

Today is the first day of Advent. üïØ

This year I am spending the period of Advent in my new home in Spain, before heading back to England to spend Christmas with my family. 
Nowadays, an advent calendar can take many forms, but essentially, it is a board that follows the Christmas countdown. Starting on 1st December and ending on Christmas Day, its 25 fold-out windows reveal a piece of chocolate, sweet or gift per day.

In the UK, most children (and adults) await their traditional chocolate advent calendars with anticipation, so that they can enjoy 24 days of chocolatey goodness. In the commercialisation of Christmas over the past few years, you can now even get tea, cheese and lipstick advent calendars. Although I would happily eat 24 pieces of cheese! 
This year, I have opted for the more traditional (and healthier) advent calendar which is much appropriate for how my my new home and country celebrates Christmas. It‚Äôs now 24 days until Christmas but only 20 days until I see my family, which is what Christmas is about for me. 
I hope it‚Äôs been a #sundayfunday wherever you are in the world! ‚ù§Ô∏èüíö #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #french #english #business #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #spain #barcelona #espa√±a  #wanderlust #expat #expatlife #digitalnomad #advent #christmas

I‚Äôm determined to find time every day to work on my Spanish. Although immersion in a language may be the quickest way to learn a language, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs necessarily the best way. I have always started learning languages in a classroom and therefore I‚Äôm going to study everyday to ensure I revise all my verbs and tenses and I have all the grounding I need to complement my spoken Spanish. I hope to start having some proper lessons at the @unibarcelona in the new year but for now, I‚Äôll stick to my books and practicing my Spanish at every available opportunity! ¬°Vamos! üá™üá∏ #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #french #english #business #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #spain #barcelona #espa√±a  #wanderlust #expat #expatlife #digitalnomad #spanish #studygram #study

This is my first post from my Barcelona office so hola amigos! It‚Äôs looking more like an apartment and less like an office so far, as I‚Äôm taking some time off this week to focus on settling in and getting my office ready for next week. 
Last night I went desk shopping at @ikeaspain. Here I am testing out potential new desks. üíª

The one I have my eye on has handy drawers to keep my stationery in and it will fit perfectly next to the doors out to the balcony. This way, I can stare at the Barcelona sky as I work. Perfecto! 
Next mission: to find a fab new second screen for my desk in the #blackfriday sales. Challenge accepted! ¬°Que tengan un buen d√≠a! ‚ò∫Ô∏è #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #french #english #business #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #spain #barcelona #espa√±a #travel #wanderlust #expat #digitalnomad #europe #spanish

Sorry I have been a little bit quiet on here, it‚Äôs most unlike me to be quiet (it never happens). The last few weeks have been full of work, prioritising my family and preparing for the big move to Barcelona...which is on Sunday!

Here are two wonderful gifts from one of my closest friends. They are perfect and I can‚Äôt wait to start writing my Barcelona business plans for @coleytranslates in the beautiful French-themed @papier notebook. It‚Äôs almost too nice to write in! üòç The @lonelyplanet guidebook is also going to come in handy over the next few weeks while I find my way around my new home.

Have you packed I hear you ask? No I haven‚Äôt. üôàThe only thing that I have put in my suitcase so far is a box of @yorkshiretea as Brits abroad should never be without it.

Two sleeps and counting! üá™üá∏ #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #french #english #business #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #spain #barcelona #espa√±a #languagematters #travel #wanderlust #stationery #lonelyplanet #expat #expatlife

@translatingforeurope #2019TEF in Brussels üáßüá™ Another working week is well underway but one of the presentations from this event really moved me and I really wanted to share it with you.

Ellie Kemp is the Head of Crisis Response at @translatorswb and she opened her presentation by saying that language is a vulnerability, just like age, gender and disability, when you don‚Äôt have access to it. Perhaps shocking to some, but true nonetheless. Ellie spoke with pure passion for her work and is clearly a humanitarian translator at heart.

The issues being dealt with in humanitarian crises are fundamental ones. She talked to us about how some key concepts in humanitarian work are very difficult to translate because they are related to such difficult issues and therefore, finding the right words isn‚Äôt easy. 
Mental health services were translated as ‚Äòservices for crazy people‚Äô in Nigeria. 
Gender-based violence in the Rohingya crisis was tricky to translate because there was no word for gender like in a lot or languages so it was translated as violence from women which got interesting reactions when aid workers went around the camp asking for information about violence from women. 
Machine translation was a hot topic at this year‚Äôs event and this is relevant to translation in the humanitarian field. We as translators certainly made our case for human translation throughout the event, but I think it would be fair to say that this was an area in which we would openly embrace the use of machine translation apps and technology in the most remote places in the world, in order to enable communication in minority languages, when it is not always possible to use or find humans with the right skills. ‚ù§Ô∏è #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #traveltuesday #french #english #business #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #brussels #belgium #brexit #europeancommission #translatingeurope #travel #europe #languagematters

Day 1 of @translatingforeurope #2019TEF in Brussels üáßüá™ The keynote speech on the first day was given by David Jemielity who is the Head of Translation at Banque Cantonale Vaudoise in Switzerland. He discussed how his translation team designed their own added value in order to be heard in the business and they now have a sit down with the CEO every week. The days where translators type away in the basement of office buildings are long gone. We should be seen and heard! No one reads a text like a translator so their added value is fundamental to any business

He really got my attention when he spoke about the hotly debated issue of specialisation in translation. Being a jack-of-all-trades and master of none sprung to mind as I sat in the @europeancommission listening to one of my favourite presentations of the whole event.

His emphasis on the need to specialise really struck a chord with me. You wouldn‚Äôt go to a criminal solicitor to initiate divorce proceedings, so why should the translation industry be any different?! Specialise and spend all your time translating in that area. Before you know it, you will be a pro. Why not take it one step further and become hyperspecialised? 
I‚Äôm thinking of becoming hyperspecialised in contracts, intellectual property and EU law seeing as that‚Äôs what I work on the most. What would you like to become a hyperspecialist in? 
But most of all, what I learned from this speech,  was that if you are able to work in a field that you love, you are very rich. Choose wisely. üá™üá∫ #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #traveltuesday #french #english #business #specialized #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #brussels #belgium #brexit #europeancommission #translatingeurope #travel #europe

Day 1 of the @translatingforeurope #2019TEF in Brussels üáßüá™ Here I am as proud as punch with my badge which gave me access to the @europeancommission for two days! It was fantastic for @coleytranslates to be associated with the European Commission, albeit it only for two days. As someone who has always loved languages and loved all things European, it made me feel like I had made it and I was right where I was meant to be. 
Here are some things which really resonated with me during the morning sessions of day 1:
*46% of EU citizens only speak their mother tongue. (This is very disappointing and it needs to change!)
*Languages help people to understand each other.
*Multilingualism is intrinsic to our culture.
*European languages are world languages too. *‚ÄùAll European countries are dwarves individually but together, they are a giant.‚Äù- G√ºnther Oettinger
*Europe does not want the UK to leave. 
Tomorrow, I‚Äôll provide an insight into a hotly debated issue at this year‚Äôs event...the wonderful world of specialisation in translation. üá™üá∫ #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #traveltuesday #french #english #business #international #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #brussels #belgium #brexit #europeancommission #translatingeurope #travel #europe

Coley Translates is in the (@europeancommission) building. üá™üá∫ I‚Äôm not sure how to put the last few days at the @translatingforeurope #2019TEF into words and I‚Äôm good with words, I have built a business on translating them. 
I will share my thoughts on the event‚Äôs sessions every day next week, so that as many of my colleagues as possible can benefit from the event. 
I would also like to say a huge thank you to @iriastudio, @maria.isabel.bolivar, @ewthetranslator, @r._celia, @eyeofshiva, @emiliamacdermot, @emmabecciu and @sssssssyue for making it a fantastic event- it was a pleasure to meet you lovely ladies and I hope to meet you in another country or at another event very soon.

That‚Äôs all from me this week and I‚Äôll leave you with my application for this year‚Äôs event because I thought it was more important than ever to participate in this event as it may be the last time that I am classed as a British AND EU citizen. üò≠ ‚ÄúI would like to explore more areas of specialised translation on a European level; an environment which I have loved being a part of all my life. I may lose my rights as an EU citizen after Brexit but I think that discussing translation with fellow professionals in an ever-changing Europe is as fundamental as it ever can be. I have always classed myself as European and although I may not be an EU citizen for much longer, I will always strive to uphold the EU values and strive for integration.‚Äù üíôüíõ #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #traveltuesday #french #english #business #international #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #brussels #belgium #brexit #europeancommission #translatingeurope #travel #europe

Day 1 in Brussels üáßüá™ Merci beaucoup and echt heel erg bedankt to this lovely lady @jvtraduction who took time out of her busy week to make a special journey to Brussels from nearby Charleroi to show me around the city before #2019TEF starts tomorrow. It was great to put the world to rights regarding the use of social media in the translation industry and make plans to see each other again at the BP20 Conference over some classic chips and mayo. We met on Instagram as colleagues and now she has left as a friend. 
A great start to my trip and I can‚Äôt wait to get to the @europeancommission tomorrow for a fantastic few days with new and old colleagues! üá™üá∫ #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #traveltuesday #french #english #business #international #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #brussels #belgium #europeancommission #2019tef #translatingeuropeforum #travel #digitalnomad

Just catching a flight to Brussels to try and avoid this Brexit business and attend the Translating Europe Forum. I‚Äôll be at the European Commission for a limited time only until 31st January (maybe). üá™üá∫ #coleytranslates #translator #translation #freelance #freelancetranslator #freelancer #freelancetranslation #translatorlife #legaltranslator #xl8 #translate #traveltuesday #french #english #business #international #languages #linguist #legal #law #eu #european #brussels #belgium #brexit #europeancommission #2019tef #translatingeurope #travel #digitalnomad

As a translator, editing and revising is such a fundamental part of your own translation process, but also when you are reviewing another translator‚Äôs work. 
As a translation student, I used the previous edition of this book to learn about how to revise the work of others and my own work or edit original work. As a professional translator, I still use it. This book is really helpful for those hoping to improve their self-revision ability. This is something which has improved considerably after using this book and also after editing and revising other translators‚Äô work. 
Revising and editing are seen as reading skills aimed at spotting problematic passages. Changes are then made to meet some standard of quality that varies with the text and to tailor the text to its readership.

This week I treated myself to the revised fourth edition which includes new chapters on revising machine outputs and news trans-editing, a new section on reviser competencies, and a completely new grading scheme for assignments.

Which resources do you use when you are editing and revising? üìù

#traveltuesday 
I‚Äôm heading to the @europeancommission next week for the Translating Europe Forum. I have given myself an extra day in Brussels to explore the city as I have never been before, so it‚Äôs not all work and no play. I‚Äôm looking forward to catching up with colleagues and friends over a coffee or my favourite Belgian beer. 
If you have any tips for the best things to see and do in Brussels, I would love to hear them.
